data.title: Great Food!
data.text: I had a sample platter and roast pork on the side. My spouse had a shrimp dinner with rice and black beans. It was delicious. This place is very nice and clean. The waitress was the best. Everything was great! Will definitely come back.

data.title: First time visit -- will be back again!
data.text: It was our first time there.  Food is excellent.  We only had a few appetizers, but will certainly be back to explore more of the menu.  What a wonderful addition to Des Plaines.

data.title: Dinner before the show
data.text:
My husband and I went there before a show at the Metropolis. It was early so quite empty but by the time we left it was filling up. 
I had the jibarito dinner with lechon. The lechon was so soft and falling apart it was very tender. It was a huge portion too. I only ate 1/2 and then my husband had some and I still took a large portion home. My dinner came with rice, beans and coleslaw too.
My husband had the skirt steak which he enjoyed too and then the chips and two different salsas.

data.title: Loved it
data.text: Went a few times for the lunch buffet. Not large but everything is fresh and home cooked and delicious. They have a selection of Mexican, Puerto Rican, and Cuban food. My wife is from Cuba, and even she was impressed. Price of $10 is great and includes drink and dessert. Cant wait to go back,

data.title: Short on menu, long on taste
data.text: While their menu doesn't have the standard burritos and quesadillas that you would expect of a Latino restaurant, what they have is done well. If you want Puerto Rican, Cuban or Colombian, this is the place to go. Great service, full plate of delicious food. The lechon was fabulous. I will be returning to explore more of the menu.

data.title: Authentic made-fresh latin cuisine
data.text:
It's about a 25 mile drive for me but a friend and I decided to head there last week.
This place rocks!  Puerto Rican, Colombian, some Mexican foods, all authentic and delicious.  We each had the Lechon (Puerto Rican seasoned, roasted pork) which was accompanied with beans, rice, salad. For an appetizer we shared an order of empanadas.  
The food was outstanding and the price/value was incredible.
I'll be back.

data.title: Good food with limited menu
data.text:
This is one of the newer restaurants in the Des Plaines area. And it is quite good. Since it opened, we have been there twice so far, and will be going there regularly. We haven't tried their lunch buffet yet, but I'm sure that will change soon.

On our two visits, we ordered a few appetizers. The Yuca Frita is quite good and made for an excellent alternative to fries. I just wish the dipping sauce is a bit more interesting than what they served. We ended up dipping them in the salsa that they gave us with the tortilla chips.

And if you wish to be able to finish your entree, do not order the the chicken wings. Oh my lord, I could just eat that and be happy. These are not even the full chicken wings. They are the drumetts that have been Frenched, i.e. the meat pulled to one end, leaving the bones to be used as handles. They are delicious, sticky, sweet, and finger-licking good!

The entrees, in general, are very good. The Lechon was crazy good. I've also ordered the skirt steak Cuban style and Puerto Rican style. The meat was very good, but I was expecting a bit more flavor and seasoning for each one of them. They felt like as if they were cooked with just salt and pepper.

As for drinks, I think they have the best Horchata anywhere. I've ordered it on both visits, and will continue to order it in the future.

The one thing that I found a bit disappointing is in the range of the menu. I think if you want to do a menu that includes Puerto Rican food, not having Mofongo is a major omission. I also think that there is a glaring shortage of seafood and stews from the three Latin regions being represented. They need to have other meats such as goat, lamb, etc. or various other cuts of meat such as tongue. I know that it is impossible for them to cover every single groups of cuisine here, and I'm sure they're rather do a few things very well rather than a lot of things poorly. Still, the limited range of the menu is the first thing that hit me when we first went here.

In any case, this is some place that we will go back to. The portions are generous, and the service is very friendly. It has enough unique items to make it interesting.

data.title: Very good buffet.
data.text: Went with the family. It was very good food. The selection was varied and all options were great. Service was slow, but they were busy. Enjoyed it and will definitely return.

data.title: Wowed by Excellent Food and Service
data.text: Great food, service, and atmoshphere.  The owner greeted us and seated us in the patio area.  He asked if this was our first visit to the restaurant, and we indicated that it was. He explained the menu and suggested some choices.  The Jiberato sandwiches--pork and steak--were SUPERB!  The menu had many excellent choices, so it was hard to decide, but we were pleased with our choices based on the owner's suggestions.   The chips and salsa were excellent, also.  This place is a must!  The owner talked to us when we were finished and asked us how we enjoyed the meal. We will be back!  We learned about El Bistro Latino by Googling restaurants when visitng the Des Plaines area, and the reviews are right on target.  This place was great!

data.title: Covers different Latin cuisines
data.text: My family and I enjoyed our dinner at el Latin bistro.  We did not have a reservation, but were seated immediately.  Our waitress sat us down ,but did not give us time to look at menu.  Thankfully we looked on line so we knew we wanted the maduros (plantains) and the fried yucca.  Chips and salsa were brought.  We were told to order right away because food would take about 45 minutes.  We ordered.  The watermelon aqua Fresca was refreshing and a it sweet.  A gentleman came around and gave samples of horchata and hibiscus aqua Fresca and they were both good.  The plantains and yucca were both good.  The sauces that accompanied them, one was sweet for the plantains and the other one was a ketchup/mayo blend for the yucca- better than French fries.  I ordered the puerto rican Style skirt steak that came with rice, Puerto Rican style beans, tostones (plantain garlic chips), potato salad and chimichurri style sauce.  Tasty and plenty of food!  My mom had the lechon- was good, needed some crispy skin.  My cousin had the steak sopes and she enjoyed them and my son had the crispy chicken taco and ate the whole thing along with some of my rice and steak.  We also ordered. A chile relleno with cheese and it was cheesy and the batter was not heavy.  Was my favorite along with the chimichurri sauce and fried yucca.  Would eat there again.  Our waitress was not too warm, but efficient.  The other waitresses were friendlier and one refilled our chips.  They were supposed to close at 9:00pm, but people were still walking in past 9:00 pm and were being seated.

data.title: Birthday Dinner
data.text: Great food, great staff, great ambience! The fresh chips that they bring out while you wait for your food, are SO good!! The Jibarito was HUGE!

data.title: Worth the wait
data.text: BYOB. You will be waiting awhile, but it is worth it. While your waiting, try the Yuka. It is to die for. All the food is great. Family run with great service.

data.title: You have to try this place!!
data.text: This restaurant is excellent!  The employees and owners are all very nice and very gracious.  It is a BYOB restaurant, so they don't serve alcohol.  The lunch buffet is small, but they pack many different choices into that small space.  They have many choices and the prices are very reasonable.  The only downside is that I wish they were open later at night.  However, I have to respect that it is a family business and they probably have those hours so that they can also have family time.  Maybe over time they will be open later, but for right now, you have to get in while they are open and give this place a try!  The family is local.

data.title: The Best Jibarito Ever!
data.text: This place is amazing. Clean and neat with excellent service and AMAZING food. The Jibarito is the biggest and best I've ever had, the Puerto Rican rice is just like I remember it tasting back home...just awesome! Come and check this place out.

data.title: Love love love this place
data.text: Best food in Des Plaines! My husband and I visit just about once a week. Food is always good along with the service. Eddy the owner is just the nicest guy and always makes us feel welcomed and always makes time to chat. A few of my favorite things are the Cuban black beans, Puerto Rican rice, empanadas and cheese quesadilla with el pastor. I hope this restaurant is here to stay!!

data.title: Good Family Run Latino BYOB
data.text: This is a nice looking restaurant with a colorful, informal dining room.  It also has outdoor seating.  This is family run and recently opened.  The Lichon dinners my wife and I had were very good.  There was enough food to bring home and have another dinner for the both of us.  In hindsight, I should have ordered 1 Lichon dinner and 1 of the special Shrimp dinners that also looked good.  That way we could have split and learned more about the place. Next time.  The BYOB is a bonus many people took advantage of.

data.title: Try something new!  Fun experience, super friendly staff!
data.text: I have now dined here twice and will be heading back on a regular basis.  My favorite so far is the skirt steak with plantains.  I usually shy away from the "multi-ethnic" restaurants that seem to be popping up but I pushed myself to try El Bistro Latino due to a write up in the local paper.  I'm so happy I did, the food is fantastic!  Family owned, clean, easy to find, big parking lot, outdoor seating available.  It is a great reasonable place to try new things!  The wait staff is very knowledgable and eager to help you discover the menu.  They even bring samples to try, so much fun!  Great for families, couples, casual atmosphere, and bonus, it's also BYOB!

data.title: Great food, large portions
data.text: We stopped here for lunch on Saturday because we read a positive review in our local paper. It's Mexican-Cuban-Puerto Rican-Colombian cuisine. We had the Lechon dinner and the Cuban sandwich dinner. Both meals were very tasty, portions were large and the service was good. They have a lunch buffet during the week and we'll be back to try it. BYOB.

data.title: New Place/Family Run/FRESH, HIGH QUALITY FOOD, Fair prices
data.text:
I've been to the restaurant twice, but this review is for Father's Day lunch, when I brought my family with me for the first time.

Although the place is very new, virtually all the tables were reserved when we got there at noon.  They made a table for four available for us, but the next party they weren't able to accommodate.

The Father's Day menu was Prix Fixe, with a price of $20 per person.  We hadn't planned on spending that much, but I prevailed upon our party to go with the flow.

Because there were four of us, and there were four different appetizers, we shared all of them....

After an iceberg salad for each of us, we also shared all four of the offered entrees...Coconut Chicken, Steak, Chili Relleno, and Slow cooked pork.  All were unbelievably excellent, and the portions required us each to take sizable amounts home.

There were three offerings for dessert, so we ordered one of each, an an extra piece of cheesecake.  DO NOT MISS THE CHEESECAKE!  It's the creamy New York style.

A word about the service: Though the restaurant was filling up rapidly, the servers continued to bring the food at a very reasonable pace.  We each had soft drinks, which they kept topped off fairly frequently.  Considering the newness of the place, and the size of the crowd, I'd say that they handled it very nicely!

All in all, the $20 seemed like a great value.

Two additional notes:

1.  El Bistro Latino is BYOB.  TAKE NOTE!
2.  There is a pleasant outdoor patio for when the weather cooperates.  Father's Day was just too hot for us to eat outside.
